attributes.action: extend the Athens Password system - giving electronic access to official records and academic journals - to everyone who registers their interest with a public library or university or college library (regardless of academic status).
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
The present system of Athens passwords
excludes readers who may be registered
as an external reader in a university
library but who are neither students
or staff members of that institution.

As libraries increasingly throw out the paper copies of journals and books with the excuse that these are now available as 'electronic resources', the digital divide increases between those with an Athens Password by virtue of status and interested scholars without this access.

Ordinary members of the public are also put at a disadvantage when wishing to access records held in The National Archives or consult those official statistics held electronically as a
result of not having Athens access.

This petition suggests one concrete measure that would cost virtually nothing to implement but which is
entirely compatible with the PM's
recent speech on liberty. Making
Athens Passwords available as of
right to every member of a public
library is the logical extension
of earlier campaigns to unchain
books and teaching folk to read.
